author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! âœ…

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

> A small package to standardize LaTeX bibitems to my liking.

That sounds a very borderline to being a "personal utility", which [wouldn't be suitable for registration in General](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#should-i-register-my-package-now). Are you sure that it's necessary or useful to register the package at this point? It would help if it had functionality to standardize bibitems not just to _your_ liking, but to the (potentially different) liking of a broad audience. That is, to be suitable for General with a broad name like that, it should have options to, e.g., customize the format for citation keys, or which fields to clean up

Fair enough. I just wanted an easy way to share these utilities with a couple of people that share my preferences about how to organize bibitems. 

Although adding some options would be straightforward, I guess I could also keep it as is and use LocalRegistry.jl instead. I wasn't aware of this package--thanks!

IMO, it would also be possible to register this under a highly distinctive name, e.g., `PerbyeBibStandardizer`. Technically, that still violates the rule against "personal utility packages", but I don't really see the point of interpreting that rule that strictly. Others might differ on that. _My_ objection is only for a package with a general name that is not general in scope.

But setting up a personal `LocalRegistry`, or just letting people [`Pkg.add` it as an unregistered package](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/managing-packages/#Adding-unregistered-packages) is also a good solution. As long as a package is not a dependency of some other registered package, registration in General is not an absolute necessity.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]
